desc: An effect that triggers after the Combat Phase.
Slay each hero this unit deals physical damage to.
Slay each creep this unit deals physical damage to.
Applies to units as long as they are within a given area.
Return to hand or the fountain.
Remove mana from the enemy player.
Cleave damage is dealt to all adjacent enemies in the combat phase. Doesn't hit towers.
Can affect a lane other than the caster's.
Destroyed when replaced by another item.
An effect that is processed after this unit dies.
This unit will take extra damage in combat. Ignores armor entirely.
When this unit is placed on top of another unit, it gains that unit's Attack and Health.
Disarmed units do not strike their target in battles or in the combat phase.
Removes an enchantment.
An enchantment lasts until dispelled, remaining even through death.
A Tower Enchantment is a spell that adds a permanent effect to a tower or lane. Tower Enchantments are not units and do not occupy combat positions.

Each lane contains an allied tower that must be defended and an enemy tower that must be destroyed. The objective of the game is to destroy any 2 enemy towers. The tower can be a target of some spells and abilities.
Excess Attack damage dealt to this unit is dealt to the tower in the combat phase.
When heroes die they are placed in the Fountain zone for a full round before becoming ready to redeploy. When heroes enter the Fountain they are fully healed and temporary effects on them are purged.
Select a new target for this effect.
This unit heals equal to its Attack if it survives a combat in which it damaged another unit.
Cards cannot be played as long as they are locked. Lock is applied for a duration in rounds. At the end of a round, all locked cards lose 1 Lock. Locked cards are revealed.
An effect which applies to this unit when adjacent to an allied hero.
When played, draw a card from your deck that costs less than this one.
Piercing damage is not reduced by the target's armor.
Piercing damage is not reduced by the target's armor.
This unit steals 2 gold from the opponent whenever it damages their tower.
An additional effect that is processed at the time you play this card.
Removes modifications and temporary effects, but not damage. Purging does not affect base abilities or external effects, such as those from equipped items and continuous effects from auras.
Move a unit 1 slot randomly left or right to an unoccupied spot.
Take another action. If you use this action to pass, you retain the initiative to act first in the next round.
During a battle, units with quickstrike attack before units without quickstrike. Units that die from this damage do not attack.
When targeted or attacked, non-reflected damage that would be done to this unit is instead dealt to the caster or attacker.
When a unit strikes another unit with Retaliate, the striking unit takes Retaliate damage as physical damage.
Prevent a unit from moving. Lasts until the end of round by default.
Prevent a unit from moving. Lasts until the end of round by default.
An effect which triggers when the card's owner passes.
During the combat phase, deal Siege damage to the enemy tower as physical damage.
A unit deals its Attack damage to its target in a one-way battle. Combat attributes such as Armor, Retaliate, and Piercing are applied.
Stunned units can't be casters and can't use their active abilities or active abilities of their items. Stunned units can't strike in battles or in the combat phase.
Stunned units can't be casters and can't use their active abilities or active abilities of their items. Stunned units can't strike in battles or in the combat phase.
Move a unit to the targeted slot. If occupied, switch positions with that unit.
When a unit taunts all of its adjacent enemies change their combat target to that unit. Targets reset after each round.
Excess Attack damage by this unit is dealt to the enemy tower in the combat phase.
Can't be chosen as a target by the opponent.
The unit heals this amount during the combat phase. Regeneration is applied before checking for death.
Attack ▣, Cleave, Siege, and Retaliate, are physical damage.

A hero is a unit that allows you to play cards of its color in its lane. A hero can equip items. When it is killed, it is worth 5 Bounty to the opponent and returns to the Fountain to be redeployed later.

A creep is a non-hero unit. Unlike a hero, a creep cannot equip items, and does not return to play after it is killed. It is worth 1 Bounty to the opponent when killed. When played, a creep card puts a unit into an empty combat position of your choice.
A spell is a card that has a one-time effect and is then removed from the game. Spells deal damage, modify objects in play temporarily or permanently, summon units, or draw cards.
Silenced units can't be casters and can't use their active abilities or active abilities of their items.
Kill a unit. Death Shields may save it, but Damage Immunity does not.
Mana is a resource used to play cards and activate abilities. Each round the amount is increased by 1 and refreshed.
The amount of gold awarded to the opponent when a unit dies.
Armor absorbs this much incoming damage each round. If negative, amplify the first source of incoming damage by this amount.
If a unit would die, instead remove its death shield and it survives with 1 Health. A unit may only have one death shield at a time.
A unit with Damage Immunity does not take damage. It will still die when slain.
An effect that triggers after Deployment and before the Action Phase.
Creates a unit puts it directly into play.
Ephemeral cards disappear from your hand at the end of the round.
Summon a copy of this unit.
Transform a unit into a harmless form that can perform no actions.
Passive abilities on this unit are disabled.
Repeatable cards may be cast multiple times in one round. Abilities with triggers ignore Repeated cards.
When a unit strikes another unit, it deals its Attack ▣ to that unit as physical damage, unless a different amount is specified. Disarmed units and stunned units cannot strike.
When a unit strikes another unit, it deals its Attack ▣ to that unit as physical damage, unless a different amount is specified. Disarmed units and stunned units cannot strike.
